children.text: There is a waterproofing gap along the external wall at the opening, which could allow water to leak into the frame and cause possible future damage.
Part 3.8.1.2 of the Building Code of Australia (NCC/BCA) - Wet Areas, states that;
‘Building elements in wet areas within a building must-
be waterproof or water resistant in accordance with Table 3.8.1.1; and
The relevant Australian Standard AS 3740 – Waterproofing of domestic wet areas states in section 3.9.1 Perimeter flashing that

‘Perimeter flashing to wall/floor surfaces shall be continuously sealed to the horizontal surface and have a vertical leg of a minimum of 25mm above the finished floor level, except across doorways, and the horizontal leg shall be a minimum width of 50mm’.
The builder must install a fully waterproofed perimeter to all of the wet areas of this home as required by the NCC/BCA and the relevant Australian Standard AS 3740.
